result.execSummary:
The defendant Marquez Taj-Malik Nash was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Marquez Taj-Malik Nash was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Marquez Taj-Malik Nash is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Marquez Taj-Malik Nash was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Marquez Taj-Malik Nash was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent, with credit for 7 days served.
Court ordered defendant to sign up for probation no later than 4:00 pm on 10/14/22.

miscConds.notes: - Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.

- No contact with firearms.
- Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- No contact with victim unless approved by the court.

- Complete batterer's intervention program or a course in anger management.
- Complete Parenting Classes.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
- Cooperate with the agent and all rules of probation.
- Provide a DNA sample during the term of probation.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
Court ordered matter expunged upon successful completion of probation.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marquez Taj-Malik Nash in court.  Attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg in court for Marquez Taj-Malik Nash.  
Prosecuting attorney Ryan Jay Michaels in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
BRANCH 1 FOR BRANCH 29.
Parties prepared to proceed with sentencing. State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 4:  Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent, with credit for 7 days served. 

AS TO COUNT 5:  Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent, with credit for 7 days served. 

Court STAYED the sentence(s) and placed the defendant on probation for 12 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:

- Complete batterer's intervention program or a course in anger management.
- Complete Parenting Classes.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- Cooperate with the agent and all rules of probation.
- No contact with victim unless approved by the court.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Provide a DNA sample during the term of probation.

- Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.

*Court advised defendant of appellant rights. 
*Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
*Court ordered defendant to sign up for probation no later than 4:00 pm on 10/14/22.

Received and filed: 
Pretrial Sentence Credit, 
Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 

COURT ORDERED MATTER EXPUNGED UPON SUCCESSFUL COMPLETION OF PROBATION
Case set for a sentencing hearing. Branch 29 is in trial and unable to hear this case. Case spun to Branch 1, Judge Davila. Parties notified.
filed.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 10-12-2022, filed.

Jury Trial exhibits from 7/26/2022 inventoried on this date.
Location: BOX 789.
Request for payment of $34 witness fees for witness Montesha P. processed and forwarded on 8/5/22 to the AP/Treasurer's Office on Invoice #AT000096 WF in court 2x on 7/25/22, 7/26/22.
Assignment of bail money

Defendant in court with attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

At the hour of 01:44 PM the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict which was then read.  

As to Count 1: "We, the jury, find the defendant, Marquez Taj-Malik Nash , NOT GUILTY of Strangulation and Suffocation, as charged in the Information".  

As to Count 2: "We, the jury, find the defendant,  Marquez Taj-Malik Nash, NOT GUILTY of Battery, as charged in the Information".  

As to Count 3: "We, the jury, find the defendant,  Marquez Taj-Malik Nash, NOT GUILTY of Disorderly Conduct, as charged in the Information".  

As to Count 4: "We, the jury, find the defendant,  Marquez Taj-Malik Nash, GUILTY of Battery, as charged in the Information".  

As to Count 5: "We, the jury, find the defendant,  Marquez Taj-Malik Nash, GUILTY of Disorderly Conduct, as charged in the Information".  

Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed. 

At the hour of 02:02 PM jury dismissed for the day.

Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict as to counts 4 and 5.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction as to counts 4 and 5.

Case adjourned for sentencing hearing to Br 29.

Defendant Marquez Taj-Malik Nash in court with attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for Jury Trial. Trial proceeded. Jury deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Cabral, and Lee who were duly sworn for that purpose. Jury question and answer put on the record. Jury in the Box at 09:23 AM. Court plays exhibit #32 for the Jury. Jury out of Box. Additional jury question and answer put on the record. Court in recess for lunch. Court adjourned to 01:00 PM.Sentencing hearing scheduled for 10/12/2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Marquez Taj-Malik Nash in court with attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Trial continued. Jury in the box at 01:47 PM. Sworn for the state:  City of Milwaukee police officer Matthew Pagelsdorf. Side bars placed on the record. Trial proceeded. Exhibit  32 received. Side bar placed on the record. Trial proceeded. State rests subject to rebuttal. Jury out of box for break at 02:15 PM. Defense motion for directed verdict at close of state's case denied by the court. Court held Colloquy with defendant regarding his right to testify. Defendant knowingly and willingly WAIVED his right to remain silent. Jury in the box at 02:32 PM.  Sworn for defense: Marquez Taj-Malik Nash. Side bar placed on the record. Trial proceeded. State and defense rest. Testimony closed.  Jury out of box. Defense motion to dismiss at close of evidence argued and denied by the court.  Jury in the box. Court instructed jury. Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Court orders parties dismissed for the day but ordered to return at 08:30 am on 07/27/2022, branch 29.


  Jury trial scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marquez Taj-Malik Nash in court with attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Jury Trial. Jury panel in court at the hour of 09:31 am. Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impaneled and sworn. Jury list received and filed.  Court ordered witnesses sequestered.  Court instructed jury. Opening statements by state and defense.  Side bar placed on the record. Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Montesha Pringle. Exhibits 1 - 26 received. Exhibit 31 received. Side bar placed on the record. Court in recess for lunch. Court adjourned to 01:30 PM.

Defendant Marquez Taj-Malik Nash in court with attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Jury Trial. Jury panel in court. Voir dire proceeded at the hour of 02:16 PM.  Strikes for cause proceeded in chambers. Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impaneled. Court orders parties dismissed for the day but ordered to return at 09:00 am on 07/26/2022, branch 29.  Jury trial scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Marquez Taj-Malik Nash in court with attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Jury Trial. Parties prepared to proceed. Court passes case to address court calendar.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring; no contact order.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Court ordered no contact with MTP (dob 8/31/2000)
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Marquez Taj-Malik Nash in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Defendant Marquez Taj-Malik Nash in custody.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Marquez Taj-Malik Nash appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer Branch 29.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 2, 3, 4 and 5.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE for Branch 29.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
